They have a compact and sturdy body with strong hind legs, which are adapted for hopping. Wallabies have a head that is relatively small compared to their body size, with large, round eyes and small, rounded ears. 

Their fur can vary in color, but most commonly, wallabies have a brown or grayish-brown coat, which helps them blend into their natural habitat. Some species may have lighter or darker markings on their fur, such as stripes or spots. 

Wallabies have a long, muscular tail that helps them maintain balance while hopping and also acts as a counterbalance when they change direction. Their front limbs are shorter and less developed compared to their hind limbs, and they have sharp claws on their feet for climbing and grasping.
koala:
This is a photo of a koala. A koala is a small, bear-like mammal native to Australia. It has a round, compact body covered in thick, woolly fur that is usually gray or brown in color. The fur helps to insulate the koala and protect it from extreme temperatures. 

Koalas have a large, rounded head with a prominent black nose and small, round ears. They have sharp claws on their front paws, which are adapted for climbing and gripping tree branches. 

One of the most distinctive features of a koala is its large, round eyes. These eyes are positioned towards the front of the head, giving the koala excellent depth perception. 

Koalas have a specialized diet consisting mainly of eucalyptus leaves, which they are able to digest due to a unique digestive system. They have strong jaws and teeth for chewing the tough leaves.
wombat:
This is a photo of a wombat. A wombat is a medium-sized marsupial native to Australia. It has a sturdy and compact body with a barrel-shaped appearance. Wombats have short, muscular legs and strong claws, which they use for digging burrows. They have a thick and coarse fur that can vary in color from sandy brown to dark brown or gray. 

Wombats have a large, square-shaped head with small, round ears and small, black eyes. They have a broad, flat nose and a wide mouth. One of the most distinctive features of a wombat is its backward-facing pouch, which helps to keep dirt out while digging. 

On average, wombats measure about 1 meter (3.3 feet) in length and weigh between 20 to 35 kilograms (44 to 77 pounds). They have a short tail, which is barely visible, and their hind legs are longer and more powerful than their front legs.
jellyfish: This is a photo of a jellyfish. A jellyfish is a soft-bodied marine creature that typically has a bell-shaped body with long, trailing tentacles. The bell-shaped body is usually transparent and gelatinous, giving the jellyfish its characteristic appearance. Inside the bell, there is a central cavity that serves as the jellyfish's stomach. The tentacles, which can vary in number and length, are usually covered in stinging cells called nematocysts, which the jellyfish uses to capture prey and defend itself. Some jellyfish have vibrant colors, while others are more translucent.
sea anemone:
This is a photo of a sea anemone. A sea anemone is a marine creature that belongs to the phylum Cnidaria. It has a cylindrical body shape with a soft and gelatinous texture. The size of a sea anemone can vary, ranging from a few centimeters to several feet in diameter.

The body of a sea anemone consists of a column-like structure called a "pedal disc" at the base, which attaches to a solid surface such as a rock or coral. From the pedal disc, the body extends upwards into a tubular shape, which is often adorned with numerous tentacles.

The tentacles of a sea anemone are one of its most distinctive features. They are long, slender, and arranged in a circular pattern around the mouth, which is located at the center of the body. The number of tentacles can vary among different species, but they can range from a few to several hundred.

Sea anemones come in a wide variety of colors, including shades of green, brown, red, orange, and purple. Some species even have vibrant patterns or fluorescent hues. These colors are due to pigments within the cells of the anemone's tissues.
brain coral:
This is a photo of a brain coral. A brain coral is a type of coral that belongs to the family Faviidae. It gets its name from its unique appearance, which resembles the folds and ridges of a human brain. The coral's surface is covered in a series of convoluted, maze-like patterns that create a distinct texture.

Brain corals come in various colors, including shades of brown, green, gray, and even vibrant hues of purple and blue. The coloration is often influenced by the presence of symbiotic algae called zooxanthellae, which live within the coral's tissues.

The size of a brain coral can vary, but they can grow quite large, with some species reaching several feet in diameter. The individual polyps, which make up the coral, are small and have a cylindrical shape. They extend their tentacles to feed on plankton and other small organisms in the water.
flatworm:
This is a photo of a flatworm. A flatworm, also known as a planarian, is a soft-bodied invertebrate that belongs to the phylum Platyhelminthes. It has a flattened, elongated body shape, hence the name "flatworm." The body of a flatworm is typically thin and ribbon-like, with a distinct head region.

The size of a flatworm can vary, but most species are relatively small, ranging from a few millimeters to a few centimeters in length. Some species, however, can grow up to several meters long.

Flatworms have a simple body structure without any specialized respiratory or circulatory systems. They have a single opening that serves as both the mouth and the anus, located on the ventral side of their body. This opening is surrounded by sensory structures called auricles.

The body of a flatworm is usually covered by a layer of ciliated cells, which help with locomotion and feeding. Some flatworms also have specialized structures called eyespots that allow them to detect light.

Flatworms come in a variety of colors, including shades of brown, gray, and even vibrant hues. Some species have distinct patterns or markings on their body, while others may be more uniformly colored.
nematode: This is a photo of a nematode. A nematode, also known as a roundworm, is a small, unsegmented worm that typically has a cylindrical body shape. They are usually transparent or whitish in color, although some species may have pigmentation. Nematodes have a smooth, flexible body covered in a tough, protective cuticle. They have a distinct head region with a mouth and sensory structures, such as sensory bristles or papillae. The body of a nematode is divided into three sections: the head, the elongated middle region called the body proper, and the tail. They have a complete digestive system, with a mouth at the anterior end and an anus at the posterior end. Nematodes vary in size, ranging from microscopic to several centimeters in length, depending on the species.
conch: This is a photo of a conch. A conch is a type of marine mollusk that has a spiral-shaped shell. The shell is typically large and can range in color from pale pink to orange or brown. It has a smooth and glossy surface with distinct ridges that spiral around the shell, gradually getting larger towards the opening. The opening of the shell is usually narrow and elongated, with a flared lip at the end. Inside the shell, a conch has a soft body with a muscular foot and sensory tentacles.
snail: This is a photo of a snail. A snail is a small, slow-moving creature with a soft, slimy body. It has a coiled shell on its back, which serves as its protective covering. The shell is usually brown or gray in color and has a spiral shape. The body of a snail is elongated and covered in a moist, mucus-like substance. It has a pair of tentacles on its head, with the longer one having eyes at the tip. The snail uses these tentacles to sense its surroundings and navigate its environment.
slug: This is a photo of a slug. A slug is a soft-bodied creature that belongs to the mollusk family. It typically has a slimy and moist appearance. Slugs have a long and cylindrical body, which is usually smooth and without any visible limbs. They come in various colors, including shades of brown, gray, black, and even some vibrant hues like yellow or orange. The body of a slug is covered in a layer of mucus, which helps it move smoothly across surfaces. They have a pair of retractable tentacles on their head, with the upper pair being longer and used for sensing their surroundings. The lower pair is shorter and carries their eyes at the tips.
sea slug:
This is a photo of a sea slug. A sea slug is a type of marine gastropod mollusk that comes in a wide variety of shapes, sizes, and colors. However, they generally have a soft, elongated body with no external shell. Their bodies can range from a few centimeters to several inches in length.

Sea slugs have a unique and fascinating appearance. They often have vibrant and striking colors, including shades of red, orange, yellow, blue, green, and purple. Some species even have intricate patterns and markings on their bodies.

Their bodies are usually slim and cylindrical, with a distinct head and a pair of sensory tentacles called rhinophores on top. These rhinophores help them detect chemicals and navigate their surroundings. Sea slugs also have a pair of eyes, although their vision is limited.

One of the most remarkable features of sea slugs is their ability to undergo incredible transformations. Some species can change their colors and patterns to blend in with their surroundings or to warn predators of their toxicity. This ability to camouflage or advertise their defenses is known as aposematism.
chiton:
This is a photo of a chiton. A chiton is a type of marine mollusk that has a unique and distinctive appearance. It has a long, narrow body that is covered by a series of overlapping plates or shells, which are called valves. These valves are made of a tough, protective material called chitin.

The overall shape of a chiton is elongated and somewhat flattened, resembling a small shield or a segmented armor. The valves are arranged in a row along the length of the body, providing protection and flexibility. The number of valves can vary depending on the species, but most chitons have between 6 and 8 valves.

The coloration of chitons can vary greatly, ranging from dull shades of brown, gray, or black to vibrant colors like red, orange, or blue. Some species even have intricate patterns or markings on their valves, which can help with camouflage or identification.

Chitons have a muscular foot that they use for locomotion, and they also have a head with a mouth and sensory organs. They typically have a row of tiny eyes along the edges of their valves, which allow them to detect light and movement.
chambered nautilus:
This is a photo of a chambered nautilus. A chambered nautilus is a unique marine creature that has a distinctive appearance. It has a soft body enclosed in a hard, spiral-shaped shell. The shell is divided into numerous chambers, which are connected by a series of curved walls called septa. These chambers are formed as the nautilus grows, with the newest and largest chamber located at the outermost part of the shell.

The shell of a chambered nautilus is usually pearly white or light brown in color, with intricate patterns of ridges and lines. It has a smooth and glossy texture. The nautilus can retract its body into the shell, using a muscular foot that extends from the opening of the shell.

The nautilus has a head with two large, stalked eyes and a mouth surrounded by tentacles. It also has a pair of simple, leaf-like appendages called cirri, which it uses for sensory purposes. The nautilus has a soft, fleshy mantle that covers its body and secretes the shell.
Dungeness crab: This is a photo of a Dungeness crab. A Dungeness crab is a type of crab that is commonly found along the west coast of North America. It has a distinctive appearance with a hard, reddish-brown shell that is covered in small bumps and spines. The body of a Dungeness crab is round and wide, with four pairs of walking legs and a pair of large, powerful claws. The front pair of claws are larger and more robust, while the back pair are smaller and more slender. The claws are typically a darker shade of brown or black. The crab's eyes are located on stalks and are usually a reddish color.
rock crab: This is a photo of a rock crab. A rock crab is a type of crab that is typically found along rocky coastlines and in tidal pools. It has a hard exoskeleton that is usually brownish or greenish in color, helping it blend in with its surroundings. The body of a rock crab is round and compact, with a wide shell that covers its back and a smaller shell covering its abdomen. It has ten legs, with the front two legs being larger and equipped with sharp claws. These claws are used for defense, capturing prey, and foraging. The eyes of a rock crab are located on stalks, allowing it to see in multiple directions.
fiddler crab:
This is a photo of a fiddler crab. A fiddler crab is a small crustacean that is commonly found in coastal areas. It has a distinctive appearance with a square-shaped body and a hard exoskeleton. The body of a fiddler crab is usually about 1-2 inches wide, but can vary depending on the species.

The most notable feature of a fiddler crab is its oversized claw, which is much larger than its other claw. The claw is usually brightly colored, often in shades of blue, orange, or red, and has a white or yellowish tip. This large claw is used by the male fiddler crab to attract females and to defend its territory.

The smaller claw of a fiddler crab is used for feeding and other tasks. The crab has four pairs of legs, with the front two pairs being larger and more robust than the hind legs. These legs are adapted for walking and digging in the sand.

Fiddler crabs have stalked eyes that are positioned on the sides of their head. They have a flattened body shape, which allows them to move easily through the sand. The coloration of their bodies can vary, but they are typically brown or gray, which helps them blend in with their sandy habitats.
red king crab: This is a photo of a red king crab. A red king crab is a large crustacean with a distinctive appearance. It has a round, robust body covered in a reddish-brown exoskeleton. The exoskeleton is hard and spiky, providing protection for the crab. The legs of a red king crab are long and powerful, with sharp claws at the end. These claws are typically a bright red color, which is where the crab gets its name. The front claws are larger and more robust than the back ones, and they are used for catching prey and defending against predators. The body of a red king crab can grow up to 11 inches wide, and the legs can span up to 6 feet in length.
American lobster:
This is a photo of an American lobster. An American lobster, also known as the Maine lobster, is a crustacean with a unique appearance. It has a long, segmented body covered in a hard exoskeleton. The lobster's body is divided into two main parts: the cephalothorax and the abdomen.

The cephalothorax is the front part of the lobster's body and is covered by a hard carapace. It is usually dark greenish-brown in color, but can also have shades of blue or red. The carapace is adorned with spines and has two large, compound eyes on either side.

The abdomen, also known as the tail, is long and muscular. It is segmented and ends with a fan-like structure called the tail fan. The tail fan is used for swimming and can propel the lobster backward quickly.

The lobster has five pairs of legs, with the first pair being the largest and most powerful. These legs are used for walking along the ocean floor and for capturing prey. The first pair of legs also has large, strong claws, with one claw being larger and more powerful than the other. The larger claw is called the crusher claw, used for crushing shells and prey, while the smaller claw is called the pincer claw, used for gripping and tearing.
spiny lobster:
This is a photo of a spiny lobster. A spiny lobster is a crustacean that has a distinct appearance. It has a long, segmented body covered in a hard exoskeleton. The exoskeleton is typically reddish-brown or greenish-brown in color, with darker spots or stripes. 

One of the most noticeable features of a spiny lobster is its large, spiny antennae. These antennae are long and slender, and they extend forward from the lobster's head. They are used for sensory purposes, helping the lobster detect its surroundings and locate food.

The lobster also has a pair of large, powerful claws, which are used for defense and capturing prey. The claws are usually larger in males than in females. The front claws have sharp, pointed tips, while the smaller back claws are used for grooming.

The spiny lobster has a long, segmented tail that is flattened and fan-shaped. The tail is covered in sharp spines, which give the lobster its name. These spines provide protection and aid in swimming. The lobster can rapidly flick its tail to propel itself backward and escape from predators.
crayfish:
This is a photo of a crayfish. A crayfish is a small crustacean that resembles a miniature lobster. It has a segmented body covered in a hard exoskeleton, which can vary in color from brown to greenish-brown. The body is divided into two main sections: the cephalothorax and the abdomen. 

The cephalothorax is the front part of the crayfish and contains the head and thorax. It has a pair of large, compound eyes on stalks, which provide excellent vision. The head also features a pair of long antennae and a pair of shorter antennules. The thorax has five pairs of walking legs, with the front pair modified into large, powerful pincers called chelipeds.

The abdomen of a crayfish is long and segmented, tapering towards the end. It is covered in a series of overlapping plates called uropods, which help the crayfish swim backward. At the end of the abdomen, there is a fan-like structure called the tail fan or telson, which aids in swimming and also serves as a protective cover for the gills.
hermit crab:
This is a photo of a hermit crab. A hermit crab is a small crustacean that has a soft, asymmetrical abdomen protected by a hard, curved exoskeleton. The exoskeleton is usually patterned with various colors and patterns, which can help the hermit crab blend into its surroundings. The abdomen is long and curved, allowing the crab to curl up inside its shell for protection.

Hermit crabs have ten legs, with the front two legs being modified into claws. These claws are used for various purposes, such as defense, feeding, and climbing. The remaining eight legs are used for walking and gripping onto surfaces.

One interesting characteristic of hermit crabs is that they do not have a permanent shell of their own. Instead, they use empty shells of other marine animals, such as snails, to protect their soft abdomen. As the hermit crab grows, it will search for a larger shell to move into, leaving its old shell behind.
isopod:
This is a photo of a isopod. An isopod is a type of crustacean that is commonly found in marine and freshwater environments. It has a distinct appearance with a segmented body that is flattened from top to bottom. The body is covered by a hard exoskeleton, which is typically brown or gray in color.

Isopods have a pair of large, compound eyes on the top of their head, along with a pair of antennae. They also have multiple pairs of legs, usually seven pairs, which are attached to the sides of their body. These legs are used for walking and swimming.

One of the most notable features of isopods is their ability to roll up into a tight ball when threatened. This behavior helps to protect their soft underbelly from potential predators.
white stork: This is a photo of a white stork. A white stork is a large bird with a distinctive appearance. It has a long, slender body and stands about 3 to 4 feet tall. The stork has a white plumage covering most of its body, with black flight feathers and a black tail. Its long neck is also white, and it has a pointed, yellow beak. The stork has long, thin legs that are pinkish in color, and it has webbed feet. When in flight, its wingspan can reach up to 6 to 7 feet, and it displays a graceful soaring pattern.
black stork:
This is a photo of a black stork. A black stork is a large bird with a distinctive appearance. It has a height of about 3.3 to 3.9 feet (1 to 1.2 meters) and a wingspan of around 5.9 to 6.6 feet (1.8 to 2 meters). The body of a black stork is predominantly black, with glossy feathers that have a greenish or purplish sheen in certain lighting conditions.

The head and neck of a black stork are covered in black feathers, and the beak is long, straight, and pointed. The eyes are dark and surrounded by a bare, reddish skin patch. The legs are long and red in color, with powerful claws that aid in grasping prey.

One of the most striking features of a black stork is its white underbelly, which contrasts with the rest of its dark plumage. This white patch extends from the chest down to the tail, creating a distinct color contrast.

During flight, the black stork's wings appear broad and rounded, with primary feathers that are black and secondary feathers that are white. The tail is also black, with a slight forked shape.
spoonbill:
This is a photo of a spoonbill. A spoonbill is a unique and fascinating bird with distinct physical features. It has a large, spoon-shaped bill that gives it its name. The bill is long and flat, with a broad tip that resembles a spoon. The bill is usually gray or black in color.

The spoonbill has a medium-sized body with a wingspan that can reach up to 4-5 feet (1.2-1.5 meters). Its plumage is mostly white, with some species having a pinkish hue on their wings, neck, and breast. The feathers on its head and neck are often long and flowing, giving it a graceful appearance.

The legs of a spoonbill are long and slender, typically pink or gray in color. It has webbed feet that help it wade through shallow water and muddy areas. Spoonbills are known for their unique feeding behavior, where they sweep their bill from side to side in water, feeling for prey such as small fish, crustaceans, and insects.
flamingo:
This is a photo of a flamingo. A flamingo is a tall and slender bird with long legs and a graceful neck. It stands at an average height of 3 to 5 feet (0.9 to 1.5 meters) and has a wingspan of about 4 to 5 feet (1.2 to 1.5 meters). The body of a flamingo is covered in feathers that are mostly pink or reddish-pink in color, although some species may have white or orange feathers.

The most distinctive feature of a flamingo is its long, curved neck, which allows it to reach deep into the water to catch its food. At the end of its neck, a flamingo has a small head with a downward-curving beak. The beak is usually black and has a slight hook at the end, which helps the bird filter out food from the water.

Flamingos have long, thin legs that are pink or reddish in color. Their legs are adapted for wading in shallow water, and their webbed feet help them balance on soft mud or unstable surfaces. Flamingos also have a unique way of standing on one leg, which is believed to help conserve body heat and energy.
little blue heron:
This is a photo of a little blue heron. The little blue heron is a medium-sized wading bird with a distinctive appearance. It has a slender body and long legs, which are typically dark gray or black. The plumage of the little blue heron varies depending on its age. 

Adults have a slate-blue body with a purplish-maroon head and neck. The bill is long and slender, with a dark tip. The eyes are yellow and surrounded by a patch of bare, bluish skin. The legs are also yellowish-green.

Juvenile little blue herons have a completely different appearance. They are mostly white with grayish-blue feathers on their wings and back. Their bill is grayish-green, and their legs are yellowish. As they mature, their plumage gradually changes to the adult blue coloration.
great egret: This is a photo of a great egret. A great egret is a large, elegant bird with a wingspan of about 4 to 5 feet (1.2 to 1.5 meters). It has a slender body and long, graceful legs that are black in color. The plumage of a great egret is mostly white, with a few notable features. Its long, S-shaped neck is adorned with a plume of long, delicate feathers during the breeding season. The bill of a great egret is long and pointed, and it is yellow in color. The eyes are bright yellow and stand out against the bird's white feathers.
bittern bird:
This is a photo of a bittern bird. A bittern bird is a medium-sized wading bird that belongs to the heron family. It has a stocky body with a height of about 2 feet (60 centimeters) and a wingspan of around 3.5 feet (105 centimeters). The bittern has a distinctive appearance with its long, thick neck and a pointed bill.

The plumage of a bittern is typically brown or buff-colored, which helps it blend in with its surroundings, especially in marshy or reed-filled habitats where it is commonly found. The feathers on its back and wings are streaked and patterned, providing excellent camouflage. Its underparts are usually lighter in color, ranging from pale buff to white.

One of the most notable features of a bittern is its eyes, which are large and yellow in color. It has a short tail and long, sturdy legs that are adapted for wading through wetlands. When in flight, the bittern extends its neck and legs, giving it a stretched-out appearance.
crane bird:
This is a photo of a crane bird. A crane bird is a large and graceful bird with a long and slender body. It typically stands tall, reaching heights of up to 5 feet or more. The crane has long legs and a long neck, which it extends while in flight or when searching for food. Its wingspan can be quite impressive, ranging from 6 to 8 feet.

The crane bird has a predominantly gray or white plumage, although some species may have patches of black or other colors. Its feathers are soft and sleek, giving it an elegant appearance. The head of a crane is small in proportion to its body, and it has a sharp, pointed beak that it uses to catch and eat its prey.

One of the most distinctive features of a crane bird is its elaborate crown of feathers on top of its head, which can be seen as a tuft or a crest. This crown is often brightly colored, with shades of red, orange, or gold, and it can be raised or lowered depending on the bird's mood or behavior.
limpkin: This is a photo of a limpkin. A limpkin is a large bird that measures about 25-28 inches in length and has a wingspan of around 45-50 inches. It has a unique appearance with a long, slender body and long legs. The plumage of a limpkin is mostly brown with a mottled pattern, which helps it blend in with its surroundings. Its neck is long and curved, and it has a distinctive downward-curved bill that is long and slender. The bill is pale in color with a dark tip, and it is specifically adapted for feeding on snails and other mollusks. Limpkins also have a white stripe running down their throat and a white patch on their wings, which is visible when they are in flight.
common gallinule:
This is a photo of a common gallinule. A common gallinule, also known as a common moorhen, is a medium-sized waterbird. It has a plump body with a length of about 12-15 inches (30-38 cm) and a wingspan of around 20-25 inches (50-64 cm). 

The common gallinule has a dark blackish-brown plumage overall, with a distinctive white undertail and white feathers on its flanks. Its head and neck are a dark grayish-black color, and it has a red bill with a yellow tip. The bill is fairly long and slightly curved, which helps it forage for food in the water.

Its legs are long and yellow, with long toes that have lobed flaps of skin on them, enabling the bird to walk on floating vegetation. This adaptation allows the common gallinule to navigate through marshes and wetlands with ease.

The common gallinule also has a short tail, which is often held upright when swimming or walking. Its wings are rounded and it has a slow, fluttery flight pattern.
American coot:
This is a photo of an American coot. An American coot is a medium-sized water bird that is commonly found in North America. It has a unique appearance with a black body and a white bill. The body of the coot is covered in dark gray to black feathers, which give it a sleek and smooth appearance. It has a rounded head and a short, thick neck.

The most distinctive feature of an American coot is its white bill, which is short and stubby. The bill has a slight upward curve and a white frontal shield, which extends up to the forehead. This frontal shield is often seen as a white, triangular patch on the bird's face.

The coot has bright red eyes, which contrast with its dark plumage. Its legs are long and strong, colored in a pale gray to greenish-gray shade. The feet are lobed, with each toe having a wide, flattened lobe that helps the bird swim and walk on floating vegetation.
bustard:
This is a photo of a bustard. A bustard is a large bird with a robust body and long legs. They typically have a height ranging from 2 to 4 feet (60 to 120 centimeters) and a wingspan of around 6 to 10 feet (180 to 300 centimeters). Bustards have a distinctive appearance with a broad and rounded chest, a long neck, and a small head.

Their plumage varies depending on the species, but generally, bustards have a combination of brown, gray, and white feathers. Some species have intricate patterns or markings on their wings or body. The feathers on their back and wings are usually more muted in color, while the underparts are lighter.

Bustards have a strong and sturdy bill, which is often slightly curved downwards. Their legs are long and powerful, adapted for walking and running on the ground. They also have strong wings that allow them to fly, although they are primarily terrestrial birds.
ruddy turnstone:
This is a photo of a ruddy turnstone. A ruddy turnstone is a small to medium-sized shorebird with a distinctive appearance. It has a compact and stocky body, measuring about 8-10 inches in length and weighing around 3-5 ounces. 

The plumage of a ruddy turnstone varies depending on the season. During the breeding season, the bird has a vibrant and colorful appearance. Its head and neck are mostly black, with a white patch on the forehead and a reddish-brown crown. The back and wings are a mix of black, brown, and white feathers, forming a mottled pattern. The breast and belly are white, while the flanks and sides are a rich chestnut color. The tail is dark with white edges.

In non-breeding plumage, the ruddy turnstone's appearance becomes more subdued. The head and neck lose their black coloration, turning mostly grayish-brown. The chestnut color on the flanks and sides fades, and the overall plumage becomes more grayish-brown with white and black mottling.

One of the most distinctive features of a ruddy turnstone is its bill. It is short, stout, and slightly upturned, with a black base and an orange tip. The legs are relatively short and orange in color.
dunlin:
This is a photo of a dunlin. A dunlin is a small to medium-sized shorebird that is commonly found in coastal areas. It has a compact and plump body with a short neck and a relatively long, straight bill. The plumage of a dunlin varies depending on the season.

During the breeding season, adult dunlins have a distinctive black belly and chest, with a reddish-brown back and wings. They also have a black patch on their belly and a black cap on their head. Their underparts are white, and they have black legs.

In non-breeding plumage, dunlins have a more mottled appearance. Their feathers are grayish-brown with pale streaks and spots on their back and wings. The black belly patch is less prominent, and their underparts become whiter.
common redshank: This is a photo of a common redshank. A common redshank is a medium-sized wading bird with a distinctive appearance. It has a slender body and long legs, which are reddish in color. The bird's plumage is mostly grayish-brown, with darker streaks on its back and wings. The common redshank has a white belly and a white triangle-shaped patch on its backside, which is visible during flight. Its bill is long and straight, and it is orange-red in color. The bird's eyes are dark and its neck is relatively long.
dowitcher:
This is a photo of a dowitcher. A dowitcher is a medium-sized shorebird with a distinctive appearance. It has a long, straight bill that is slightly curved downwards at the tip. The bill is dark in color, often black or gray. The body of a dowitcher is slim and elongated, with a rounded chest and a long neck.

Dowitchers have relatively long legs, which are usually a pale yellow or grayish color. Their wings are pointed and narrow, allowing for swift and agile flight. The plumage of a dowitcher varies depending on the species, but it typically consists of a combination of brown, gray, and white feathers.

During breeding season, male dowitchers may display more vibrant colors, such as reddish-brown or chestnut tones on their neck and chest. In contrast, females and non-breeding males tend to have more subdued plumage.
oystercatcher:
This is a photo of a oystercatcher. An oystercatcher is a medium-sized shorebird with a distinctive appearance. It has a long, sturdy, bright orange-red bill that is slightly curved downwards. The head, neck, and upperparts are black, while the underparts are white. The eyes are round and dark, and the legs are pinkish in color. 

The oystercatcher has a bold white stripe that runs from the forehead to the back of the head, and it has a white collar around the neck. In flight, its wings display a striking pattern of black and white, with a white wingbar and a white patch on the outer wing.
pelican: This is a photo of a pelican. A pelican is a large bird with a distinctive appearance. It has a long, broad bill that is usually curved at the end. The bill is designed to help the pelican catch fish by scooping them up from the water. Pelicans have a large wingspan, often reaching up to 7 feet, which allows them to soar gracefully in the air. They have a stocky body with a short tail and webbed feet that are adapted for swimming and diving. Pelicans have a white or light-colored plumage, with some species having additional markings such as black or brown feathers on their wings or necks. They also have a pouch of skin that hangs from their lower bill, which they use to store and carry fish.
king penguin:
This is a photo of a king penguin. A king penguin is a large species of penguin that stands about 90 to 100 centimeters (35 to 39 inches) tall and weighs around 11 to 16 kilograms (24 to 35 pounds). They have a distinctive appearance with a black head, back, and wings, while their belly and chest are white. 

King penguins have a long, slender neck and a pointed beak that is black in color. They have a bright orange patch on each side of their head, just above their eyes. Their eyes are small and dark, and they have a short tail. 

One of the most striking features of a king penguin is its vibrant yellow-orange coloring on its chest and upper belly. This patch of color is called the "bib" and is unique to each individual, helping them recognize each other in crowded colonies. 

King penguins have strong, webbed feet that are black on the top and pink on the bottom. They use their feet for swimming in the ocean and for walking on land. They have a streamlined body shape, which allows them to swim gracefully through the water, reaching speeds of up to 12 kilometers per hour (7.5 miles per hour).
albatross: This is a photo of a albatross. An albatross is a large seabird known for its impressive wingspan. It has a long, slender body with a hooked beak and sharp, curved claws. The wingspan of an albatross can range from 6 to 11 feet, making it one of the largest flying birds in the world. Its wings are narrow and pointed, allowing it to soar effortlessly for long periods of time without flapping. The plumage of an albatross is typically white or gray, with some species having dark markings on their wings and backs. They have webbed feet, which are adapted for swimming and diving.
grey whale:
This is a photo of a grey whale. A grey whale is a large marine mammal with a distinct appearance. It has a robust body, typically measuring around 40 to 50 feet in length, although some individuals can reach up to 55 feet. They can weigh up to 40 tons. 

The most noticeable feature of a grey whale is its mottled grey coloration, which gives it its name. However, their skin can also appear to be black or even white due to patches of barnacles and other organisms that attach to their bodies. These patches of barnacles create unique patterns on each individual whale, allowing researchers to identify them.

Grey whales have a streamlined shape with a narrow, tapered head and a rounded, humpbacked body. They have a pair of small eyes located on the sides of their head, as well as a prominent, V-shaped blowhole positioned towards the front of their head. Their blowhole allows them to exhale forcefully, creating a spout of water and mist when they surface to breathe.

One of the most distinctive features of grey whales is their long, bumpy, and knobbly upper jaw, known as the rostrum. This feature is covered in patches of rough skin, which helps them during feeding by stirring up sediment on the ocean floor and filtering out small invertebrates, such as tiny shrimp-like creatures called amphipods.

Grey whales also have a series of 9 to 14 throat grooves on the underside of their body, which allow their throat to expand when they feed. These grooves can be seen when the whale opens its mouth to feed, creating a pleated appearance.
killer whale:
This is a photo of a killer whale. A killer whale, also known as an orca, is a large marine mammal that belongs to the dolphin family. They have a distinct appearance with a black and white coloration. The upper part of their body, including their back and sides, is mostly black, while their underside, including their belly and throat, is white. 

Killer whales have a streamlined and powerful body shape, which allows them to swim swiftly through the water. They have a tall, triangular dorsal fin on their back, which can reach up to 6 feet in height in males and is slightly smaller in females. The dorsal fin is one of the distinguishing features of a killer whale.

Their head is large and rounded, with a prominent forehead called a melon. They have a pair of small, beady eyes on either side of their head, and a large, powerful tail fluke that they use for propulsion. Their pectoral fins, located on either side of their body, are long and paddle-shaped.

Killer whales have a set of sharp, conical teeth that are used for hunting and feeding. They have between 40 to 56 teeth, which can vary in size depending on the individual. Their teeth are designed to grasp and tear apart their prey, which primarily consists of fish, squid, seals, and other marine mammals.
dugong:
This is a photo of a dugong. A dugong is a large marine mammal that resembles a combination of a manatee and a dolphin. It has a robust and streamlined body, with a rounded head and a snout-like mouth. Its body is covered in thick, wrinkled skin that is usually gray or brown in color. 

Dugongs have paddle-like flippers at the front of their bodies, which they use for swimming and maneuvering in the water. They also have a large, horizontally flattened tail, known as a fluke, which helps them propel through the water. 

One of the most distinctive features of a dugong is its tail fluke, which is forked at the tips. This sets it apart from manatees, which have rounded tails. 

Dugongs have small eyes and ears, located on the sides of their heads. They also have bristly whiskers, called vibrissae, around their mouths, which help them detect and locate food in the water.
sea lion:
This is a photo of a sea lion. A sea lion is a marine mammal that belongs to the family Otariidae. They have a streamlined body with a large, barrel-shaped chest and a long, muscular neck. Sea lions have a thick layer of blubber that helps them stay warm in cold waters. 

They have a short, broad snout with a prominent whisker pattern. Their eyes are large and round, providing them with excellent vision both in and out of the water. Sea lions have external ear flaps that can be closed to prevent water from entering their ears while swimming.

One of the distinguishing features of sea lions is their flippers. They have long, powerful front flippers that they use to swim and navigate through the water. These flippers have a claw on each digit, which helps them move on land. Sea lions also have smaller, less-developed hind flippers that they use for steering and propulsion in the water.

The coloration of sea lions can vary, but they typically have a dark brown or grayish coat. Adult males, known as bulls, are usually larger and have a thicker neck and a mane of coarse hair around their neck and shoulders. Females, known as cows, are generally smaller and lack the mane.

Dalmatian: This is a photo of a Dalmatian. A Dalmatian is a medium-sized dog breed with a distinctive appearance. They have a well-muscled body and a square-shaped build. Their coat is short and dense, featuring a unique pattern of spots. The base color of their coat is usually white, and the spots can be black or liver (brown). Dalmatians have a long, elegant head with a slightly rounded skull and a well-defined stop. They have medium-sized, round eyes that are usually dark in color. Their ears are set high and are of moderate size, dropping down close to the head. Dalmatians have a strong, straight muzzle with a black or liver nose. They have a strong jaw with a scissor bite. Their neck is muscular and arched, leading to a deep chest and well-sprung ribs. Dalmatians have a level topline and a moderately long tail that tapers towards the end. They have strong, straight legs with well-arched feet.
Affenpinscher:
This is a photo of an Affenpinscher. An Affenpinscher is a small breed of dog with a distinctive appearance. They have a sturdy and compact build, standing about 9-11 inches (23-28 cm) tall at the shoulder and weighing around 7-10 pounds (3-4.5 kg). 

Their head is round and proportionate to their body, with a short muzzle and a prominent brow. They have dark, round eyes that are alert and expressive, and their ears are set high on the head, either cropped or natural, and can be erect or dropped. 

One of the most notable features of an Affenpinscher is their shaggy and wiry coat. It is dense and rough, with a longer and thicker coat around the head, neck, and shoulders, giving them a distinctive "monkey-like" appearance. The coat comes in various colors, including black, gray, silver, or a combination of these colors.

Their tail is usually docked to a short length, and they have small, compact feet with black nails.
Basenji:
This is a photo of a Basenji. A Basenji is a small to medium-sized dog breed with a unique appearance. They have a compact and muscular body, typically weighing between 22 to 26 pounds (10 to 12 kilograms). Basenjis have a distinctive head shape, with a flat skull and a well-defined stop. Their eyes are almond-shaped and dark in color, giving them an alert and intelligent expression.

One of the most notable features of a Basenji is their ears, which are erect and set high on their head. They are small and pointed, adding to their overall alert appearance. Basenjis also have a strong neck and a deep chest, giving them a balanced and athletic build.

Their coat is short, fine, and dense, which helps them adapt to different climates. Basenjis come in various colors, including red, black, brindle, and tricolor combinations. They often have white markings on their chest, feet, and tail tip.

Basenjis have a unique tail that is tightly curled over their back, giving them a distinctive silhouette.
pug: This is a photo of a pug. A pug is a small breed of dog with a distinctive appearance. They have a compact and muscular body, with a square-shaped head and a short, wrinkled face. Their eyes are large and round, usually dark in color, and their ears are small and folded over. Pugs have a short, smooth coat that can come in various colors, such as fawn, black, or silver. They have a curly tail that is usually tightly curled over their back. Pugs are known for their adorable and expressive facial expressions, with their wrinkled forehead and deep wrinkles around their nose and mouth.
Leonberger:
This is a photo of a Leonberger. A Leonberger is a large and majestic dog breed. They have a strong and muscular build, with a deep chest and a broad back. They stand tall with a proud posture. Leonbergers have a distinctive lion-like appearance, with a thick and dense double coat that comes in various shades of gold, red, or brown. Their fur is water-resistant and weatherproof, allowing them to withstand harsh climates.

Their head is noble and expressive, with a broad skull and a well-defined stop. They have a black mask that extends over their muzzle, which adds to their regal appearance. Their eyes are medium-sized and dark, conveying a gentle and intelligent expression. Leonbergers have pendant ears that hang down close to their cheeks.

One of the most striking features of a Leonberger is their large and powerful paws, which are webbed and ideal for swimming. They have a long and bushy tail that hangs down when at rest but is carried higher when they are alert or in motion.
Newfoundland dog: This is a photo of a Newfoundland dog. A Newfoundland dog is a large and powerful breed. They have a thick double coat that is water-resistant, which helps them in their natural affinity for water. Their coat can be black, brown, gray, or Landseer (white with black markings). They have a broad and massive head with a well-defined stop. Their eyes are dark and expressive, and their ears are small and triangular, lying close to their head. Newfoundland dogs have a strong and muscular body with a deep chest and a straight back. They have a thick tail that hangs down and is carried low when they are relaxed.
Great Pyrenees dog:
This is a photo of a Great Pyrenees dog. A Great Pyrenees dog is a large and majestic breed. They have a strong and sturdy build with a well-muscled body. They typically stand between 25 to 32 inches (63 to 81 cm) tall at the shoulder and weigh between 85 to 115 pounds (39 to 52 kg).

Their head is proportionate to their body, with a slightly rounded skull and a well-defined stop. They have a straight and strong muzzle, with a black nose and dark, almond-shaped eyes that exude intelligence and gentleness. Their ears are medium-sized, triangular in shape, and set high on the head, hanging down close to the cheeks.

Great Pyrenees dogs have a thick double coat that provides insulation and protection from harsh weather conditions. The outer coat is long, coarse, and straight, while the undercoat is dense and soft. Their coat is predominantly white, although they may have markings of gray, tan, or badger on their ears, face, and tail.

Their neck is strong and muscular, leading to a broad and deep chest. They have a level topline and a well-developed hindquarters. Their tail is long and plumed, carried low when at rest and raised in a gentle curve when alert or in motion.
Samoyed:
This is a photo of a Samoyed. A Samoyed is a medium to large-sized dog breed known for its beautiful and fluffy white coat. They have a sturdy and muscular build with a strong neck and a deep chest. Their head is wedge-shaped, with a slightly rounded skull and a well-defined stop. They have dark, almond-shaped eyes that are usually expressive and intelligent-looking. Their ears are erect and triangular in shape, set high on the head. 

One of the most distinctive features of a Samoyed is their thick double coat, which consists of a soft and dense undercoat and a longer, harsher outer coat. This coat helps them withstand cold weather conditions. Their fur is usually pure white, although some may have cream or biscuit-colored markings on their ears or face. 

Samoyeds have a friendly and gentle expression, often accompanied by a perpetual smile. They have a well-balanced and graceful gait, with their tail carried over their back in a gentle curve.
Pomeranian: This is a photo of a Pomeranian. A Pomeranian is a small dog breed known for its fluffy and luxurious coat. They have a compact and sturdy body with a fox-like face. Pomeranians have a distinctive double coat, with a dense and soft undercoat and a longer, straight outer coat that stands out from their body. Their coat comes in a variety of colors, including orange, black, white, cream, blue, brown, and sable. They have a plumed tail that curls over their back, and their ears are small and erect. Pomeranians have a bright and alert expression with dark, almond-shaped eyes and a small, black nose. They have a compact and well-proportioned body, with a straight back and a slightly rounded chest.
Chow Chow:
This is a photo of a Chow Chow. A Chow Chow is a medium to large-sized dog breed with a distinctive appearance. They have a sturdy and muscular build, with a square-shaped body. Their head is broad and flat, with a short, wide muzzle. Chow Chows have small, triangular, and erect ears that are set high on their head.

One of the most notable features of a Chow Chow is their dense and fluffy double coat. Their outer coat is thick, coarse, and straight, while their undercoat is soft and woolly. The coat can come in various colors, including red, black, blue, cinnamon, and cream. Some Chow Chows also have a cream-colored or white coat.

Their tail is set high and curls over their back, resting on either side. Chow Chows have a distinctive "lion-like" appearance, with a thick ruff of fur around their neck and a mane-like appearance on their shoulders.
Keeshond:
This is a photo of a Keeshond. A Keeshond is a medium-sized dog breed with a distinctive appearance. They have a sturdy and well-proportioned body with a square-shaped build. Their head is wedge-shaped, with a medium-length muzzle and a well-defined stop. Keeshonds have dark, almond-shaped eyes that are set obliquely and give them an intelligent and alert expression.

One of the most notable features of a Keeshond is their beautiful double coat. The outer coat is typically a mixture of gray, black, and cream colors, giving them a striking "spectacles" effect around their eyes. Keeshonds also have a distinctive ruff around their neck and a plumed tail that curls over their back.

brussels griffon:
This is a photo of a brussels griffon. A Brussels Griffon is a small breed of dog known for its unique appearance. They have a sturdy and compact body with a square-shaped build. Their head is large in proportion to their body, with a domed forehead and a short, broad muzzle. The most distinctive feature of a Brussels Griffon is their expressive face, which is characterized by large, round, and dark eyes that give them a human-like expression. They have a short, black nose and a well-defined chin.

Their ears can be either cropped or left natural, and they are usually set high on the head. If left natural, the ears are small and held erect. The breed has a strong jaw with a scissor bite.

Brussels Griffons have a dense and wiry coat that comes in two varieties: rough and smooth. The rough-coated variety has a longer, harsh outer coat with a dense undercoat, while the smooth-coated variety has a short, glossy coat that lies close to the body. The most common colors for Brussels Griffons are red, black, black and tan, or a combination of these colors.
Pembroke Welsh Corgi:
This is a photo of a Pembroke Welsh Corgi. A Pembroke Welsh Corgi is a small, sturdy dog with a distinctive appearance. They have a long body, short legs, and a fox-like face. Their head is slightly rounded with a well-defined stop. They have medium-sized, oval-shaped eyes that are usually dark in color and have an intelligent and alert expression. Their ears are erect and pointed, adding to their adorable appearance.

One of the most notable features of a Pembroke Welsh Corgi is their fluffy, double coat. The outer coat is weather-resistant and dense, while the undercoat is soft and thick. They come in various colors, including red, sable, fawn, and black and tan. Some Corgis may also have white markings on their chest, neck, and legs.

Pembroke Welsh Corgis have a docked tail, which is traditionally done when they are puppies. However, in some countries, tail docking is now illegal, so you may see Corgis with a natural, long tail. Their legs are short but strong, allowing them to move quickly and efficiently.
Cardigan Welsh Corgi:
This is a photo of a Cardigan Welsh Corgi. A Cardigan Welsh Corgi is a small to medium-sized dog with a sturdy and muscular build. They have a long body and short legs, giving them a unique and adorable appearance. Their head is proportionate to their body, with a slightly rounded skull and a well-defined stop. They have medium-sized, round eyes that are usually dark in color and have an intelligent and alert expression.

Their coat is thick, weather-resistant, and of medium length. The Cardigan Welsh Corgi comes in various colors, including red, sable, brindle, black, and blue merle, often with white markings on the chest, neck, legs, and face. Some may also have a white blaze on their forehead.
Toy Poodle:
This is a photo of a Toy Poodle. A Toy Poodle is a small and elegant breed of dog. They have a compact and well-proportioned body with a graceful appearance. Their head is rounded with a long, straight muzzle and dark, expressive eyes. Their ears are long and hang close to their head, framing their face. 

Toy Poodles have a dense and curly coat that is often groomed in various styles, such as the classic "poodle cut" with shaved body and pom-poms on the tail and legs. Their coat comes in a variety of colors, including black, white, apricot, silver, and chocolate.

They have a straight and slender neck that leads to a level topline and a well-set tail that is carried high. Their legs are straight and slim, with small, oval-shaped feet. Toy Poodles have a confident and alert posture, always ready for action.
Miniature Poodle:
This is a photo of a Miniature Poodle. A Miniature Poodle is a small-sized dog with a distinctive appearance. They have a well-proportioned body with a square-shaped build. Their head is rounded, and they have a long, straight muzzle. Their eyes are oval-shaped and dark, giving them an alert and intelligent expression. The ears are long and hang close to the head.

One of the most notable features of a Miniature Poodle is their curly, dense coat. Their fur is thick and curly all over their body, which gives them a fluffy appearance. The coat comes in a variety of colors, including black, white, brown, gray, apricot, and red. Standard Poodle:
This is a photo of a Standard Poodle. A Standard Poodle is a large and elegant dog breed known for its distinctive appearance. They have a well-proportioned and athletic build. Here are some key physical characteristics of a Standard Poodle:

1. Size: Standard Poodles are considered the largest among the three Poodle varieties. They typically stand between 18 to 24 inches (45 to 61 cm) tall at the shoulder and weigh between 45 to 70 pounds (20 to 32 kg).

2. Coat: Their coat is dense, curly, and non-shedding, which makes them hypoallergenic. Poodles have hair instead of fur, which requires regular grooming to prevent matting. Their coat comes in a variety of solid colors such as black, white, brown, gray, apricot, and cream.

3. Head: They have a long and refined head with a well-defined stop (the point where the forehead meets the muzzle). Their eyes are oval-shaped and dark, expressing intelligence and alertness. The ears are long and hang close to the head.

4. Muzzle: The muzzle of a Standard Poodle is long and straight, with a strong jaw. Their nose is usually black or brown, depending on the color of their coat.

5. Neck and Body: They have a long and graceful neck that blends smoothly into their well-muscled body. The body is squarely built, with a deep chest and a straight back. The ribs are well-sprung, giving them a balanced and athletic appearance.

6. Tail: The tail of a Standard Poodle is set high and carried straight. It is usually docked to about half its original length, although docking is becoming less common in many countries.
Mexican hairless dog (xoloitzcuintli):
This is a photo of a Mexican hairless dog (xoloitzcuintli). The Mexican hairless dog, also known as the xoloitzcuintli or Xolo, is a unique and distinctive breed. It comes in three sizes: toy, miniature, and standard. 

One of the most notable features of the xoloitzcuintli is its lack of hair. While some xolos may have a short, smooth coat, others are completely hairless. Their skin can range in color from black, gray, bronze, or a combination of these shades. The skin is often warm to the touch and can be prone to sunburn, so it's important to protect them from excessive sun exposure.

The xoloitzcuintli has a lean and muscular body with a graceful appearance. It has a long, elegant neck and a wedge-shaped head. The eyes are almond-shaped and can be dark or amber in color. The ears are large and can be either upright or slightly folded.

Their tail is long and slender, often carried in a curl or a sickle shape. Xolos have a well-developed chest and a tucked-up abdomen. Their legs are straight and strong, with small, compact feet.
grey wolf:
This is a photo of a grey wolf. A grey wolf is a large and powerful mammal with a distinctive appearance. It has a long and slender body, measuring around 4 to 6.5 feet in length, excluding the tail. The average weight of a grey wolf ranges from 70 to 120 pounds, with males being larger than females.

The fur of a grey wolf is thick and dense, providing insulation in cold climates. The coloration of their fur can vary, but it is typically a mix of shades of gray, brown, black, and white. This combination of colors helps them blend into their surroundings, providing camouflage.

Grey wolves have a broad head with a strong jaw and sharp teeth. They have a keen sense of smell, excellent hearing, and sharp eyesight, which aids them in hunting and navigating their environment. Their ears are erect and pointed, and their eyes are usually amber or yellow in color.

One of the most recognizable features of a grey wolf is its bushy tail, which is usually held low when the wolf is relaxed and raised when it is alert or in motion. The tail helps with balance and communication within a pack.
Alaskan tundra wolf:
This is a photo of an Alaskan tundra wolf. The Alaskan tundra wolf, also known as the Arctic wolf or white wolf, is a majestic and beautiful creature. It has a thick and dense double coat that helps it survive in the harsh Arctic climate. The outer coat is made up of long, coarse guard hairs that are usually white or light gray in color, providing excellent camouflage in the snowy landscape. 

Beneath the outer coat, the wolf has a soft and insulating undercoat that keeps it warm during the freezing winters. This undercoat is usually a creamy white or light gray color. The combination of these two layers of fur helps the wolf blend seamlessly into its surroundings.

The Alaskan tundra wolf has a strong and muscular build, with a broad chest and powerful legs. It has a relatively large head with a strong jaw and sharp teeth, which it uses for hunting and feeding. Its ears are small and rounded, helping to reduce heat loss in the cold climate.

The eyes of the Alaskan tundra wolf are usually a striking yellow or amber color, providing a sharp contrast against its white fur. This helps it see clearly in low-light conditions, which are common in the Arctic region.
red wolf or maned wolf:
This is a photo of a red wolf or maned wolf. A red wolf is a medium-sized canid with a distinctive reddish-brown fur coat. They have a slender and agile body, with long legs and a bushy tail. Red wolves have a narrow head with a pointed snout and upright ears. They typically have a black muzzle and a white throat and underbelly. Their fur is thick and coarse, providing insulation during colder months.

On the other hand, a maned wolf is a unique-looking canid with a fox-like appearance. They have long, slender legs and a slender body. The most striking feature of a maned wolf is its long, reddish-brown fur mane that runs along the back of its neck and shoulders. This mane can be raised when the wolf feels threatened or excited. They have a narrow head with a pointed snout and large, rounded ears. Their fur is typically a mix of reddish-brown and black, with long, black legs and a black-tipped tail. Maned wolves also have a white throat and underbelly.
coyote:
This is a photo of a coyote. A coyote is a medium-sized canid, resembling a small wolf. It has a slender and agile body with a bushy tail. On average, coyotes measure about 32 to 37 inches in length, excluding the tail, which can be an additional 16 to 20 inches long. They typically weigh between 20 to 50 pounds.

Coyotes have a thick, dense fur coat that can vary in color from grayish-brown to reddish-brown, depending on the region and season. Their fur helps them blend into their surroundings. They have a pointed snout, erect ears, and yellow or amber-colored eyes. Their legs are relatively long, allowing them to run swiftly and jump high.

One distinctive feature of a coyote is its bushy tail, which is usually carried low to the ground when the animal is on the move. Their tail can be black-tipped and often has a white underside. Coyotes also have sharp teeth and powerful jaws.
dingo:
This is a photo of a dingo. A dingo is a medium-sized wild dog native to Australia. It has a lean and athletic build, with a body length of about 3.5 to 4 feet (1 to 1.2 meters) and a shoulder height of around 1.9 to 2.2 feet (60 to 70 centimeters). Dingoes typically weigh between 22 to 44 pounds (10 to 20 kilograms).

They have a distinctive appearance with a pointed snout, erect ears, and almond-shaped eyes. Their fur can vary in color, ranging from sandy yellow, reddish-brown, to light brown. Dingoes often have a lighter underbelly and white markings on their chest, paws, and tail tip.

Their legs are relatively long, allowing them to move swiftly and cover large distances. Dingoes also have strong jaws and sharp teeth, which they use for hunting and scavenging.
dhole:
This is a photo of a dhole. A dhole, also known as an Asiatic wild dog, is a medium-sized canid species native to Asia. It has a distinctive appearance that sets it apart from other canids. Here is a description of a dhole:

Size: Dholes are about the size of a large domestic dog, with an average length of 3 to 4 feet (90 to 120 cm) from head to body, and a tail length of around 12 to 18 inches (30 to 45 cm). They stand about 2 feet (60 cm) tall at the shoulder.

Body: Dholes have a lean and muscular body, designed for agility and endurance. Their body shape is similar to that of a domestic dog, but with a more elongated torso. They have a deep chest and a narrow waist.

Coat: The dhole's coat is typically short and dense, providing protection against the elements. The coloration can vary, but it is usually a reddish or golden-brown hue. Some individuals may have a darker or lighter coat, and there can be variations within the species.

Head: Dholes have a relatively large head in proportion to their body size. Their muzzle is pointed and elongated, similar to that of a fox. They have a prominent forehead and a pair of rounded ears that are set apart.

Eyes: Dholes have almond-shaped eyes that are usually amber or yellowish-brown in color. Their eyes are known for their keenness and intelligence.

Teeth: Like other canids, dholes have a set of sharp, carnivorous teeth. They have long canine teeth for capturing and killing prey, as well as molars for grinding food.

Tail: The dhole's tail is bushy and usually held in a horizontal or slightly curved position. It helps with balance and communication within the pack.
African wild dog:
This is a photo of an African wild dog. An African wild dog, also known as an African painted dog or Cape hunting dog, is a medium-sized carnivorous mammal native to sub-Saharan Africa. Here is a description of its appearance:

1. Size: African wild dogs are about the size of a large domestic dog, with an average height of around 30 inches (75 cm) at the shoulder and a length of about 3.5 to 4.5 feet (1 to 1.4 meters) from head to tail.

2. Body: They have a slender and athletic build, with a long, narrow muzzle and large, rounded ears. Their bodies are covered in short, coarse fur, which is usually a mix of colors including white, black, and various shades of brown or yellow.

3. Coat pattern: The most distinctive feature of African wild dogs is their unique coat pattern. They have large patches of white fur on their bodies, with irregularly shaped black or dark brown patches scattered across them. These patches are often described as resembling a painter's brush strokes, giving them the nickname "painted dogs."

4. Tail: Their tails are long and bushy, usually with a white tip. The tail helps them maintain balance while running and serves as a visual signal to other pack members during hunts.

5. Legs: African wild dogs have long legs, which contribute to their agility and speed. They have four toes on each foot, with non-retractable claws that aid in gripping the ground while running.

6. Teeth: They have sharp, pointed teeth adapted for tearing meat. Their jaws are powerful, allowing them to take down and consume their prey efficiently.
hyena:
This is a photo of a hyena. A hyena is a medium-sized carnivorous mammal with a distinctive appearance. It has a robust body with a sloping back and a large head. The hyena's fur is short and coarse, typically colored in shades of brown, gray, or tan. It has a mane of longer hair along its neck and shoulders, giving it a slightly hunched appearance.

One of the most notable features of a hyena is its strong jaws and large teeth. It has a powerful bite force, capable of crushing bones. The hyena also has a broad skull with a prominent forehead and rounded ears.

The front legs of a hyena are longer than the hind legs, giving it a slightly sloping posture. It has strong, muscular limbs with sharp claws that aid in hunting and scavenging. The hyena's tail is relatively short and bushy.

Both male and female hyenas have similar physical characteristics, but females are generally larger and more dominant in social hierarchies.
red fox:
This is a photo of a red fox. A red fox is a medium-sized mammal with a distinctive appearance. It has a slender body, measuring about 18 to 35 inches in length, excluding the tail. The tail, which is long and bushy, can add an additional 12 to 22 inches to its overall length. 

The fur of a red fox is typically reddish-brown in color, hence its name. However, the shade of red can vary depending on the individual and the region they inhabit. The fur on its belly and chest is usually white or cream-colored, while the fur on its back, sides, and legs is reddish-brown. Some red foxes may also have black fur on their paws and the tips of their ears.

Red foxes have a pointed muzzle and a pair of upright, triangular ears. Their eyes are usually amber or golden in color. They have sharp, pointed teeth and retractable claws, which they use for hunting and digging.
kit fox:
This is a photo of a kit fox. A kit fox is a small-sized fox species with a distinctive appearance. It has a slender body and relatively long legs. On average, a kit fox measures about 18 to 24 inches in length, with an additional 10 to 12 inches for its bushy tail. It weighs around 3 to 6 pounds.

The fur of a kit fox is typically a sandy or grayish color, which helps it blend in with its desert habitat. Its fur is also thick and soft, providing insulation against the extreme temperatures of its environment. The kit fox has large, pointed ears that are usually reddish in color, and these ears help it in detecting sounds and regulating body temperature.

The kit fox has a narrow face with a pointed snout and a black nose. Its eyes are large and usually yellow or amber in color. It has sharp teeth and retractable claws, which it uses for hunting and digging burrows.
Arctic fox:
This is a photo of an Arctic fox. An Arctic fox is a small to medium-sized fox species that is well adapted to survive in the harsh Arctic environment. It has a compact and rounded body with a bushy tail. The fur of an Arctic fox changes color with the seasons. In winter, it is thick and white, providing excellent camouflage against the snowy landscape. In summer, the fur turns brown or grayish-brown, blending in with the tundra.

Arctic foxes have a small head with a pointed snout and triangular ears. Their ears are rounded and furry, which helps to prevent heat loss. They also have short legs and thick fur on the soles of their paws, providing insulation and traction on icy surfaces.

The average length of an Arctic fox is around 18-26 inches (46-66 cm), excluding the tail, which can be an additional 12-16 inches (30-40 cm) long. They weigh between 6.5-17 pounds (3-8 kg), with males being slightly larger than females.
grey fox:
This is a photo of a grey fox. A grey fox is a small to medium-sized mammal with a slender body and a bushy tail. It has a unique coloration that includes a mixture of gray, black, and reddish-brown fur. The fur on its back and sides is typically gray, while its belly and throat are lighter in color. The fur on its legs is usually reddish-brown. 

Grey foxes have a pointed face with a black nose and a white or gray muzzle. They have relatively large ears that are usually black on the back and have a white or gray patch on the front. Their eyes are typically yellow or amber in color.

The tail of a grey fox is long and bushy, with a black stripe running along the top. It often has a black tip as well. This tail helps the fox maintain balance and serves as a communication tool.
tabby cat: This is a photo of a tabby cat. A tabby cat typically has a medium-sized body with a muscular build. They have a round head with a slightly pointed muzzle. The color of a tabby cat's coat can vary widely, including shades of brown, gray, orange, and cream.
tiger cat:

The stripes can be black, brown, gray, or even orange, depending on the specific coloration of the cat. The background color can vary as well, ranging from light cream to pale gray. 

Tiger cats often have a medium-sized body with a muscular build. They have a round face with a prominent muzzle and expressive eyes, which can be green, yellow, or amber in color. Their ears are usually medium-sized and slightly pointed.
Persian cat:
This is a photo of a Persian cat. A Persian cat is known for its distinct appearance. It has a round face with a short, broad nose and large, round eyes that are usually a deep, vivid color. Its ears are small and set far apart on the head. The Persian cat has a sturdy, muscular body with a broad chest and short, strong legs. Its tail is fluffy and bushy.

Persian cats come in a variety of colors and patterns, including solid colors like white, black, blue, cream, and red, as well as various combinations of tabby, tortoiseshell, and colorpoint patterns.
Siamese cat:
This is a photo of a Siamese cat. A Siamese cat is a medium-sized breed with a sleek and elegant appearance. They have a muscular body and a long, slender neck. Their head is wedge-shaped, with a straight profile and prominent cheekbones. Siamese cats have striking almond-shaped blue eyes that are one of their most distinctive features.

Their coat is short, fine, and glossy. The traditional Siamese coat color is a creamy white or fawn with darker points on their ears, face, paws, and tail. These points can be seal (dark brown), chocolate (lighter brown), blue (grayish), or lilac (pale grayish-pink). The contrast between the body color and the points is quite noticeable.

Siamese cats have a graceful and agile build, with long legs and a slim tail. They are known for their vocal nature and often have a loud, distinctive voice.
Egyptian Mau:

sloth bear:

ground beetle:

longhorn beetle:

weevil:

fly:

ant:

cricket insect:

stick insect:

praying mantis:

cicada: This is a photo of a cicada. A cicada is an insect that typically has a stout body with a length ranging from 1 to 2 inches. leafhopper:

dragonfly:

The head of a dragonfly is large and rounded, with two large compound eyes that provide excellent vision. It also has a pair of short antennae and a strong, sharp mouthpart called a mandible, which it uses to catch and consume its prey.

Attached to the thorax are four transparent wings, which are usually held outstretched when the dragonfly is in flight. damselfly:

The coloration of the body can vary depending on the species, but it is often vibrant and may include shades of blue, green, yellow, or black.

When the ringlet butterfly opens its wings, you may notice a subtle iridescent sheen, especially in sunlight. This butterfly species is known for its delicate and graceful flight, often seen fluttering low to the ground or near grassy areas.
monarch butterfly:
This is a photo of a monarch butterfly. A monarch butterfly is a beautiful insect with distinct features. It has a wingspan of about 3.5 to 4 inches (8.9 to 10.2 cm). The upper side of its wings is bright orange with black veins and borders. The wings also have white spots near the tips. On the lower side, the wings are a lighter shade of orange with black veins and white spots.

The body of a monarch butterfly is black with white spots on the abdomen. It has six legs and two antennae. The antennae are thin and long, with a slight curve at the end. The butterfly's head is small, and it has two large compound eyes.

One of the most distinctive features of a monarch butterfly is its pattern of black and white stripes on its wings. These stripes help to identify the butterfly and distinguish it from other species.
small white butterfly: This is a photo of a small white butterfly. A small white butterfly typically has a wingspan of about 1 to 2 inches. sulphur butterfly:

gossamer-winged butterfly:

starfish:
This is a photo of a starfish. A starfish, also known as a sea star, is a marine creature that has a unique appearance. It has a flat, star-shaped body with five arms, although some species can have more arms. The arms are long and slender, tapering towards the tips. The body of a starfish is covered in a tough, bumpy skin, which can vary in color and pattern depending on the species.

At the center of the starfish's body, on the underside, there is a mouth. Surrounding the mouth, you may notice small tube feet that help the starfish move and capture prey. These tube feet are equipped with suction cups, which allow the starfish to cling onto surfaces and navigate through the water.

Starfish come in a variety of sizes, ranging from a few centimeters to over a meter in diameter. They can also have different colors, including shades of red, orange, yellow, brown, and even blue. Some starfish have vibrant patterns or spines on their arms, while others have a more plain and smooth appearance.
sea urchin:
This is a photo of a sea urchin. A sea urchin is a small, spiny marine creature that belongs to the echinoderm family. It has a round or oval-shaped body covered in a hard, calcareous shell called a test. The test is made up of fused plates or skeletal elements, which are covered in long, sharp spines. The color of a sea urchin can vary depending on the species, but they are commonly found in shades of purple, red, brown, or green.

The body of a sea urchin is divided into five distinct sections, known as ambulacra, which radiate from the center. Each ambulacrum contains rows of tube feet that the sea urchin uses for movement, feeding, and sensing its environment. These tube feet are equipped with suction cups that allow the sea urchin to cling onto surfaces or navigate through the water.

At the top of the sea urchin's body, there is a small mouth surrounded by five jaws, known as Aristotle's lantern. The mouth is located on the underside of the sea urchin, and it is used for grazing on algae, seaweed, and other small organisms. Sea urchins also have a complex water vascular system that helps them regulate their internal pressure and control their tube feet.
sea cucumber:
This is a photo of a sea cucumber. A sea cucumber is a marine animal that has a unique appearance. It typically has a long and cylindrical body, resembling a cucumber, hence its name. The size of a sea cucumber can vary, ranging from a few centimeters to several meters in length.

The body of a sea cucumber is soft and flexible, covered in a tough and leathery skin. The coloration can vary depending on the species, but they are often found in shades of brown, black, or reddish-brown. Some species may have vibrant patterns or markings on their body.

One distinctive feature of a sea cucumber is its numerous tube-like feet, called tube feet, which are located on the underside of its body. These tube feet are used for locomotion and feeding. They can be seen as small, fleshy protrusions that help the sea cucumber move along the ocean floor.

At one end of the sea cucumber's body, there is a mouth surrounded by tentacles or oral tentacles. These tentacles are used for capturing food particles and transferring them into the mouth. Some sea cucumber species have more prominent tentacles than others.
cottontail rabbit: This is a photo of a cottontail rabbit. A cottontail rabbit is a small mammal with a round body and short legs. hare:

hamster: This is a photo of a hamster. A hamster is a small rodent with a round body and a short tail. porcupine:

These spines are actually modified hairs that serve as a defense mechanism. The color of a porcupine's spines can vary depending on the species, but they are typically brown or black with white or yellowish tips. 

Porcupines have a round head with a small, blunt snout and large, round eyes. They have short legs with strong claws that are well-suited for climbing trees. Their hind legs are slightly longer than their front legs, giving them a hunched appearance when they walk. 

On the underside of a porcupine, you will find soft fur that is usually lighter in color than the spines. They have a short, bushy tail that is covered in quills as well. When threatened, a porcupine can raise its quills and make itself appear larger and more intimidating to predators.
fox squirrel:

The fur of a fox squirrel can vary in color, but it is commonly a reddish-brown or grayish-brown on the upper body, while the belly is usually lighter in color.

One of the most notable features of a fox squirrel is its large, round eyes, which are usually dark in color. It also has prominent, rounded ears that are covered in fur. The squirrel's body is robust and muscular, and it has strong hind legs that allow it to leap and climb with agility.

marmot: This is a photo of a marmot. A marmot is a medium-sized rodent that is part of the squirrel family. They have a stocky body with short legs and a bushy tail. beaver:
